description:
Welcome to 7 Cadley Avenue, a tastefully designed and well-maintained family home in Point Cook that is sure to impress. Offering an open-plan layout with modern finishes and fixtures, a great backyard that the whole family will love and a quiet yet central location, there is so much to love about this property.

Daily life is sure to centre around the kitchen, living and dining area that feature on-trend timber-look flooring underfoot, muted colour tones and the perfect amount of natural light. The home cook will find all they need in the stylish kitchen including a gas cooktop, a dishwasher and ample preparation and storage space. From here you can move into the living area, or step through the glass sliding doors to the covered patio.

This delightful patio space invites you to sit back and relax as you watch the kids and pets play on the lush lawns in the private and fully fenced backyard. Also in the backyard space you'll find established raised garden beds, and a small shed that offers additional storage.

Moving back inside you'll find the master bedroom at the front of the home with a walk-in robe and ensuite, while bedrooms two, three and four each feature a built-in robe. Extending the layout further is a sitting area between bedrooms three and four which could be used as a lounge room or kids activity/study space, depending on your needs. There is also a main bathroom with a separate toilet to accommodate busy households, a well-appointed laundry room, and a double garage with internal access.

Shopping centres, schools, amenities, dining options and parks are all just a few minutes away, and those who commute to the CBD can be there in under 40-minutes.

Call to arrange your inspection today!

Disclaimer: We have in preparing the content used our best endeavours to ensure that the information contained is true and accurate, but accept no responsibility and disclaim all liability in respect to any errors, omissions, inaccuracies or misstatements in this document. Purchasers should make their own enquires and refer to the due diligence check-list provided by Consumer Affairs. Click on the link for a copy of the due diligence check-list from Consumer Affairs. http://www.consumer.vic.gov.au/duediligencechecklist
